message.content: This question requires a basic understanding of pollution and its causes. Pollution is the introduction of harmful substances or contaminants into the environment. Option (A) is correct because throwing a gum wrapper in the ocean is an example of pollution as it introduces waste into the marine ecosystem. Option (B) is incorrect because trees in a forest are not pollution, they are part of the natural environment. Option (C) is incorrect because fish swimming in the sea is also a natural part of the environment. Option (D) is incorrect because the wind carrying seeds is a natural process and not pollution.

This question requires basic knowledge about pollution and its causes. Pollution refers to the introduction of harmful substances or contaminants into the environment. Option (A) is the correct answer because throwing a gum wrapper in the ocean can contribute to pollution by introducing a non-biodegradable material into the water, which can harm marine life. Option (B) is incorrect because trees in a forest are not related to pollution. Option (C) is incorrect because fish swimming in the sea is a natural occurrence and does not indicate pollution. Option (D) is incorrect because the wind carrying seeds is a natural process and not related to pollution.

This question requires knowledge about pollution and its definition. Pollution refers to the introduction of harmful substances or contaminants into the environment. Option (A) is the correct answer because throwing a gum wrapper in the ocean is an example of pollution, as it introduces litter and potentially harmful materials into the marine ecosystem. Option (B) is incorrect because trees in a forest are not pollutants, but rather a natural part of the environment. Option (C) is incorrect because fish swimming in the sea are not pollutants, but rather inhabitants of the marine ecosystem. Option (D) is incorrect because the wind carrying seeds is a natural process of dispersal, not pollution.

Option (B) is incorrect because trees in a forest are not considered pollution. Option (C) is incorrect because fish swimming in the sea are not pollution. Option (D) is incorrect because the wind carrying seeds is a natural phenomenon and not considered pollution.
